exhibit.exhibitName: Artists Respond: American Art and the Vietnam War, 1965-1975
exhibit.description: Makes vivid an era in which artists endeavored to respond to the turbulent times and openly questioned issues central to American civic life.
With more than sixty works of art displayed year-round, the Hirshhorn Museum’s Sculpture Garden offers visitors a contemplative haven in the heart of our nation’s capital.
Dynamic ongoing permanent collection presentation, featuring more than 80 objects celebrating craft as a discipline and an approach to living differently in the modern world.

A series of 17 galleries and alcoves chronologically arranged to take the visitor from the days of contact between Native Americans and European explorers through the struggles of independence to the Gilded Age.

exhibit.exhibitName: Encountering the Buddha: Art and Practice across Asia
exhibit.description: Brings together more than two hundred artworks, spanning two millennia, to explore Asia’s rich Buddhist heritage

Diverse and wide-ranging in material, time period, style, and intended use, the objects in this exhibition span the continent of Africa to explore the importance of water for both practical and artistic purposes.

exhibit.exhibitName: On the Move: Photographs by Juana Barreto Yampey, Helena Giestas, and Olivia Vivanco
exhibit.description: This exhibition explores the connective bonds between individual and collective experiences.
